metadata.synopsis: First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell.The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: Please tell me you come in peace. Last fucker who came through here properly blew out my candles.
13.context: NodeContext: Euphemism for the player who was here earlier having killed her.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.context: InternalNodeContext: In this iteration, the player has killed all the tieflings in the grove before meeting Karlach. She will not join the player but she may be convinced not to attack them.NodeContext: Cold rage.

162.speaker: Karlach
162.text: I know what you did. All those people in the druid's grove - you slaughtered them to a man.
162.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

66.text: Did it make you feel important, huh? Did it make you feel big?
66.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

295.speaker: Karlach
295.text: Did it make you feel important, huh? Did it make you feel big?
295.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

369.speaker: Player
369.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

17.speaker: Karlach
17.text: The last person you're ever going to meet. Karlach's my name. I've got a knack for killing demons and devils, and I think I found my next target.
17.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: You've got it all wrong. I've got a contract for your head, and I'm going to take it.
207.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

152.speaker: Karlach
152.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Listen, you've got the wrong idea about me. I didn't have anything to do with what happened to those people.
58.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

262.speaker: Karlach
262.text: That's a load of shit. But you know what? Today, I have other priorities.

346.speaker: Karlach
346.text: That's a load of shit. But you know what? Today, I have other priorities.

388.text: Hahaha! Gods, you're pathetic when you lie. Come on - time to pay for you did. I hope it was worth it.

208.speaker: Karlach
208.text: Hahaha! Gods, you're pathetic when you lie. Come on - time to pay for you did. I hope it was worth it.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: Please - more violence won't change the past. Leave me be, and I'll leave you too.
191.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

251.speaker: Karlach
251.text: You're right. Violence won't change the past. But the right kind of violence can protect the future. You're dangerous. I can't let you leave.

62.text: You're right. Violence won't change the past. But the right kind of violence can protect the future. You're dangerous. I can't let you leave.

296.speaker: Karlach
296.text: You're right. Violence won't change the past. But the right kind of violence can protect the future. You're dangerous. I can't let you leave.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: If you value your life, you'll stand down.
5.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

164.speaker: Karlach
164.text: Argh! I've got enough to worry about without your screams giving my position away.
164.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

91.speaker: Karlach
91.text: Argh! I've got enough to worry about without your screams giving my position away.

133.speaker: Karlach
133.text: Get the fuck out of here. Now. Before I change my mind.

359.text: Oh, I want to live. Just not in a world with you in it.
359.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

157.speaker: Karlach
157.text: Oh, I want to live. Just not in a world with you in it.
157.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

353.speaker: Player
353.text: Listen, it was all a misunderstanding. I didn't mean for them to die.
353.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player/ max burning on 'the hells'. Max anger.

303.speaker: Karlach
303.text: You're not the worst liar I've ever met. But you're daft as a brick if you think I'm going to believe that.

337.speaker: Player
337.text: I don't have to explain myself to you.
337.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player/ max burning on 'the hells'. Max anger.

323.speaker: Karlach
323.text: True. I don't need you to speak. There's nothing you can say for yourself, anyway.

310.speaker: Player
310.text: It did, actually. I am very powerful and strong!
310.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player/ max burning on 'the hells'. Max anger.

236.speaker: Karlach
236.text: That might be true. And all your power and strength is going to lead you right where you belong. The Hells.
236.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player/ max burning on 'the hells'. Max anger.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: The memory of their curdling cries has been a balm to my blistered mind.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: It almost isn't fair, striking down a lunatic. But for someone as dangerous as you, I'll make an exception.

317.speaker: Player
317.text: I - I - I... please, there's something inside me I can't control.

299.speaker: Karlach
299.text: I know the feeling. So come on - let's see whose is worse.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: Thank the gods for you. I thought I was done there. You did me a big favour. I won't forget it.
40.context: NodeContext: A different player attacked Karlach before player came along.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: Please tell me you come in peace.
50.context: NodeContext: A different player attacked Karlach before player came along.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: Changed your mind about teaming up?

120.speaker: Karlach
120.text: Pretty sure I told you to fuck off, mate.

129.speaker: Karlach
129.text: You kill me, you bring me back. I'd be furious if I didn't want the fucker strong enough to kill me on my side.

182.speaker: Karlach
182.text: You did me in, then brought me back. I'd be impressed if I weren't so pissed off.

212.speaker: Karlach
212.text: Changed your mind about teaming up?
212.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Karlach is crouched, head in hands, breathing heavily, surrounded by flames, burning. Karlach start straight from crouched pose [Choices]
NodeContext: A sound that could be mistaken for a fire building within her, or consuming her from within

287.speaker: Player
287.text: Got it in one. Let's go after whoever's hunting you.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: No, but I'm taking your head.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: I met the people looking for you - and killed them.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I met the people looking for you - and took care of them.

6.speaker: Karlach
6.text: You - did? That's amazing. Join up with me; let me do you a favour in return.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: I met the people looking for you. They say you're a killer - a fiend.

364.speaker: Karlach
364.text: I never killed anyone that didn't deserve it. Devils, demons, and the fiends that serve 'em - no mercy.

314.speaker: Karlach
314.text: But if they've fed you some lies about me going after innocents, that's a crock of shit.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: Join my team, then. I could use someone with your talents.

329.speaker: Player
329.text: You better not be lying. If I leave you be, it'll be a leap of faith.

343.speaker: Karlach
343.text: Got no use for lies. Life's interesting enough on its own.

215.speaker: Karlach
215.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Karlach is crouched, head in hands, breathing heavily, surrounded by flames, burning. Karlach start straight from crouched pose [Choices]
NodeContext: A sound that could be mistaken for a fire building within her, or consuming her from within

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *One horn. This is the devil Wyll and the paladins of Tyr want dead.*
90.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Me?"
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Never been better." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

183.speaker: Karlach
183.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Me?"
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Never been better." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

31.speaker: Player
31.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Me?"
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Never been better." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

272.speaker: Karlach
272.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Me?"
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Never been better." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

217.text: Well fuck me. It's you. From the nautiloid. Please tell me I found you before those so-called paladins of Tyr did.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: Well fuck me. It's you. From the nautiloid. Please tell me I found you before those so-called paladins of Tyr did.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: First, I'd like to know how you controlled those flames.

116.speaker: Karlach
116.text: Nice of you to ask. Lately I've gotten used to being called 'devil'. No follow-up questions.

101.speaker: Karlach
101.text: The truth is... well, it's a long story. And I'll tell it, but -

292.speaker: Player
292.text: I don't remember you from the ship. Where were you?

241.speaker: Karlach
241.text: Now that's a story. And I'll tell it to you, too, but truth be told, we shouldn't stay here too long. See, these 'paladins' have -

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I met a group of your victims, if that's what you mean. They told me what you are.

105.speaker: Karlach
105.text: Believe me, I never killed anyone who didn't -

271.speaker: Player
271.text: Haven't met any Tyrrans lately, no.

219.speaker: Karlach
219.text: Good. Great. Glad I don't have to kill you.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: What quarrel do you have with these Tyrrans?

240.speaker: Karlach
240.text: Me? None. They're the ones chasing me down. But believe me, these so-called paladins are anything but. They -

233.speaker: Player
233.text: I serve the Just God. What quarrel have you with his faithful?

311.speaker: Karlach
311.text: Me and justice are good mates, believe me. The goons chasing me are anything but -

16.speaker: Player
16.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Try again." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

334.speaker: Karlach
334.text: Try again. And pick your next words carefully.
334.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Try again." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

375.speaker: Karlach
375.text: Well fuck me. It's you. From the mind flayers' ship. Let me guess: you met a group of burnt Tyrran paladins on your way over.

27.speaker: Player
27.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Steady on, soldier."
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Ahh. That's the stuff." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

228.speaker: Karlach
228.text: Steady on, soldier. Ahh. That's the stuff.
228.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Steady on, soldier."
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Ahh. That's the stuff." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

227.speaker: Player
227.text: She looks dangerous - watch her carefully.
227.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. She spot sthe player and locks eyes. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

304.speaker: Karlach
304.text: Well fuck me. It's you. From the ship. Haven't taken any bounties from a burnt Tyr dink, have you?
304.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. She spot sthe player and locks eyes. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

57.speaker: Player
57.text: These are no natural flames - prepare to fight.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player steps forward and Karlach rises to her full height, flames raging hotter than ever. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

340.speaker: Karlach
340.text: Stand back, or I'll melt your eyes out of your skull.
340.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player steps forward and Karlach rises to her full height, flames raging hotter than ever. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I'd know that stink anywhere. You've come from the Hells.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

322.speaker: Karlach
322.text: So I have. And it looks like a bit of the Hells have come with me.
322.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

270.speaker: Player
270.text: You there - are you from Elturel?
270.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Me?"
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"I wish." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

94.speaker: Karlach
94.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Me?"
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"I wish." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

327.speaker: Karlach
327.text: Met some of the Elturians who got trapped in the Hells, though. They did less time than me, but no easier.

286.speaker: Player
286.text: I know you - you're the monster the Blade of Frontiers is hunting.
286.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

35.speaker: Karlach
35.text: Gods, is he still on my tail? I'm embarrassed for him.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

290.speaker: Karlach
290.text: You with the so-called 'paladins of Tyr'? Or straight from the grand high devil herself?

386.speaker: Player
386.text: Neither. I just know what to do when I see a devil: kill it.
386.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire dies down. Calms to default state.

110.speaker: Karlach
110.text: I'm no devil. And you're no bounty hunter. I saw you before. On the mind flayers' ship.
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire dies down. Calms to default state.

255.speaker: Karlach
255.text: *A great heat roars through you; her heat, fiery as the Hells.*
255.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *A great heat roars through you; her heat, fiery as the Hells.*
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

149.speaker: Narrator
149.text: *Then you're lost in visions of demonic armies as you tear through a landscape of fire and blood.*
149.context: NodeContext: A bit of humor, a bit of resignation. One obstacle after another.

142.speaker: Narrator
142.text: *The Blood War. You saw it from above as the nautiloid passed through Avernus - this woman was on the front line.*
142.context: NodeContext: A bit of humor, a bit of resignation. One obstacle after another.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.context: NodeContext: A bit of humor, a bit of resignation. One obstacle after another.

247.speaker: Player
247.text: It's the tadpole in our heads. It connects us.
247.context: NodeContext: A bit of humor, a bit of resignation. One obstacle after another.

86.speaker: Karlach
86.text: Fuck's sake. Mountains as far as the eye can see.
86.context: NodeContext: A bit of humor, a bit of resignation. One obstacle after another.

127.speaker: Karlach
127.text: Guess that explains the voices. From that peek I got into your head, you've made some inroads trying to get the thing sorted. But alas, no joy.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Maybe you ought to shed some light on what I just saw.
198.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: The Blood War. But believe me, my friend, the fighting wasn't even the worst part.
82.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: From that peek I got into your head, I'm not the only one with problems on top of problems. A mind flayer tadpole, huh? And no joy getting it sorted as of yet, I see.
85.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

147.speaker: Karlach
147.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

308.speaker: Player
308.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: Well met, soldier. Now that we're old pals, how would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?
22.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

150.speaker: Karlach
150.text: A little background, if your moral compass needs something to point at...
150.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

122.speaker: Karlach
122.text: You already know I fought in the Blood War. I was good at killing demons. Really good.
122.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

179.speaker: Karlach
179.text: So good Zariel, the archdevil herself, made me her personal attack dog.
179.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

347.speaker: Karlach
347.text: I played along until I could get the fuck out of there. Took me ten years to properly escape, but now I'm free.
347.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: Zariel's sent goon after goon to hunt me down, but believe me when I tell you I'm not going.
2.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

336.speaker: Karlach
336.text: The latest yappy little dogs she's sicced on me are nearby. A group of dopes posing as Paladins of Tyr. Want to help me take 'em down?
336.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Let's send them back where they came from.
193.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

319.speaker: Karlach
319.text: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.
319.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

280.speaker: Karlach
280.text: After we've mopped them up, we can work on evicting this parasite and take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?
280.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

10.speaker: Karlach
10.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.
10.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

87.speaker: Lae'zel
87.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.
87.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

242.speaker: Karlach
242.text: I'd hug you if it wouldn't scorch your skin off.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Hang on - I said I'd help you, not team up with you long-term.

267.speaker: Karlach
267.text: Trust me - when you see what I'm capable of, you won't regret it.

285.speaker: Shadowheart
285.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.
285.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

357.speaker: Astarion
357.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
357.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

335.speaker: Gale
335.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
335.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

32.speaker: Player
32.text: So you want me to kill the people hunting you?
32.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

210.speaker: Karlach
210.text: Don't worry, I'll lead the charge. But I could use your help. There's a lot of them and only one of me. After that, we can team up. Take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?
210.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I have good news for you. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.
23.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

169.speaker: Karlach
169.text: That's incredible! In that case, you ought to let me return the favour. My muscle for your aid in my battle against the powers of the arch-bitch.
169.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

77.speaker: Player
77.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

204.speaker: Karlach
204.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

339.speaker: Karlach
339.text: But hey, erm, if we're going to travel together, I think there's something you should know.
339.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Hear that?"
She thumps her left chest with right hand, like pounding a car hood. Something mechanic clangs within.
(etc.)

239.text: Hear that? Infernal engine for a heart. Lets me burn as hot as the Hells. Seems to be running in overdrive since I left Avernus.
239.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Hear that?"
She thumps her left chest with right hand, like pounding a car hood. Something mechanic clangs within.
(etc.)

332.speaker: Karlach
332.text: Hear that? Infernal engine for a heart. Lets me burn as hot as the Hells. Seems to be running in overdrive since I left Avernus.
332.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Hear that?"
She thumps her left chest with right hand, like pounding a car hood. Something mechanic clangs within.
(etc.)

108.speaker: Karlach
108.text: Won't be seeing my mechanic any time soon, so I've been making the most of the extra heat. But it's meant I can't get too friendly. If I'm excited, nervous, scared, I'll light you up like a firework.
108.context: NodeContext: First time discussing the origin of her heart

59.speaker: Player
59.text: How the hells did you get an infernal engine for a heart?
59.context: NodeContext: First time discussing the origin of her heart

166.speaker: Karlach
166.text: High pain tolerance. And a dynamic duo of truly shitty bosses.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: You have a mechanic for your heart?
104.context: NodeContext: First time discussing the origin of her heart

300.speaker: Karlach
300.text: Wild, right? And believe it or not, I'm one of Zariel's least-mutilated pets.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: What does the engine allow you to do?
154.context: NodeContext: First time discussing the origin of her heart

156.speaker: Karlach
156.text: Burn, baby. As hot as I can tolerate. I have to admit it helps in battle, though I wouldn't have chosen it for myself - if I'd been given a choice.
156.context: NodeContext: First time discussing the origin of her heart

265.speaker: Karlach
265.text: I'll tell you the story, but I really need to find someone who can tune up my engine sooner rather than later. Believe me when I say this thing is hot.
265.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

218.speaker: Karlach
218.text: The first time I faced down those 'paladins,' they let slip they'd met an infernal mechanic in the area. A tiefling. But I didn't see him anywhere.
218.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Wonder if they meant Dammon - a tiefling weaponsmith.
118.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

76.speaker: Karlach
76.text: A weaponsmith, huh? Not sure if he's the guy, but I'd love to find out. A tune-up would do this rusty heart a world of good.
76.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Why don't you clear things with your leader before we team up. Send 'em my way so we can work out the particulars.
7.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

15.speaker: Karlach
15.text: If there's one thing Zariel taught me, it's not to fuck with the top dog until it's absolutely necessary.

254.speaker: Karlach
254.text: I'm up for it, but your party's a little full.
254.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

387.speaker: Karlach
387.text: No room in your party. What should I do?
387.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

361.speaker: Player
361.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

115.speaker: Karlach
115.text: All right - I'll catch up with you later. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?

161.speaker: Karlach
161.text: I'll catch up with you when it's time to camp, for now. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?

384.speaker: Player
384.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

256.speaker: Player
256.text: Take Astarion's place - he can head back to camp.
256.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*
81.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

376.speaker: Narrator
376.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

55.speaker: Player
55.text: If I must. But do try to keep them safe - they're a little useless without me.
55.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

176.speaker: Astarion
176.text: I would object, but sitting by the fire while you do all the hard work sounds marvellous, actually.
176.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Gale could do with a rest.
79.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

140.speaker: Narrator
140.text: I'll get little rest given the stack of unread books waiting for me - but I'll try.

273.speaker: Player
273.text: I'll get little rest given the stack of unread books waiting for me - but I'll try.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

187.speaker: Player
187.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

220.speaker: Narrator
220.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

165.speaker: Player
165.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

171.speaker: Jaheira
171.text: Well. I know when I'm not wanted.
171.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: Fine. I shall wait in our camp.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Fine. I shall wait in our camp.

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: If you insist. Don't have all the fun without me.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: You can trade places with Wyll.

366.speaker: Narrator
366.text: Off I go. You'll know where to find me!

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Off I go. You'll know where to find me!

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: All right. I know a shortcut.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: I shall remain at camp for now.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: I shall remain at camp for now.

368.speaker: Halsin
368.text: I shall be waiting. Come find me when you need me.

379.speaker: Narrator
379.text: Who would I be to question your wisdom?

243.speaker: Player
243.text: Who would I be to question your wisdom?

348.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
348.text: I will wait in camp. Patiently, even.

390.speaker: Karlach
390.text: Hang on, though - looks like you've got enough backup at your side. Not sure there's room for me.

326.speaker: Karlach
326.text: Phew, I'm getting all het up. Let's make tracks!

370.speaker: Player
370.text: There are some tieflings holed up in a druid's grove nearby. We might look there.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Sounds like a good lead. Hopefully, our guy will be among them. A tune-up would do this old tub a world of good.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I'll keep an eye out for someone like that.

99.speaker: Karlach
99.text: Thanking you. A tune-up would give this rustbox of mine a new lease on life.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: What'll happen if you don't get tuned up?

160.speaker: Karlach
160.text: Who knows! Maybe I can run like this indefinitely. But... maybe not.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: I met someone who might be able to help - a smith who worked in the Hells for a time.

275.speaker: Karlach
275.text: Well now! Maybe I could make his acquaintance? A tightened screw or two might let me keep a little calmer.

392.speaker: Karlach
392.text: Maybe even manage a pat or bump without burning someone to death. It's been a long time.

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: If you can lead the way, I'll gladly follow.

320.speaker: Player
320.text: I don't think so - you'll have to go it alone.

342.speaker: Karlach
342.text: Damn. After a decade in hell, I was hoping for a little company. Especially some who looked like you.

281.speaker: Karlach
281.text: But I can take a hint. Good luck out there. You're gonna need it.

383.speaker: Player
383.text: I have good news for you. I took care of the paladins you say were hunting you.
383.context: NodeContext: Some light flirtation in her voice.

175.speaker: Player
175.context: NodeContext: Some light flirtation in her voice.

249.speaker: Karlach
249.text: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Why should I do your dirty work?
80.context: NodeContext: Some light flirtation in her voice.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: Dirty work's the only kind I like. Gets even messier the more bodies you throw at it. Think of the potential.
11.context: NodeContext: Some light flirtation in her voice.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Why should I do your dirty work?

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: Dirty work's the only kind I like. But there are a lot of them and just the one of me. I'll take point, and you flank 'em.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: I'm here to kill you, not send you back to Zariel.

24.speaker: Karlach
24.text: Too bad. I thought maybe you could be a friend. I could've done with one of those.

229.speaker: Player
229.text: I have good news for you, then. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.

312.speaker: Karlach
312.text: You did?! That's incredible! You ought to let me return the favour. We can team up - evict this parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

185.speaker: Player
185.text: All right - welcome to the team.

189.speaker: Karlach
189.text: Why don't you clear things with your leader before we team up. Send 'em my way so we can work out the particulars.

269.speaker: Karlach
269.text: If there's one thing Zariel taught me, it's not to fuck with the top dog until it's absolutely necessary.

291.speaker: Karlach
291.text: Hang on, though - looks like you've got enough backup at your side. Not sure there's room for me.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Head to my camp, then. We can regroup later.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: All right, sure. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me. Got it?

261.speaker: Karlach
261.text: Phew, I'm getting all het up. Let's make tracks!

279.speaker: Player
279.text: I have good news for you, then. I already took care of the paladins you say were hunting you.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I have my own problems. I don't need yours.

167.speaker: Karlach
167.text: I can see that. But look, if we take care of my little problem, we can move on to ours. The tadpole.

350.speaker: Karlach
350.text: Kill some fiends, evict a parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Karlach. I met someone named Wyll who was hunting you. He said you were a devil.

226.speaker: Karlach
226.text: Ugh. Thought I'd lost the Blade of Frontiers on the mind flayer ship.

158.speaker: Karlach
158.text: Well, if it isn't obvious by now, he's wrong about me. I'll prove it to him if he stops swinging that sword around long enough to listen to sense.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: I'm your key to curing that tadpole - eventually.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: Really now? First I catch a ride out of Avernus, then I stumble into a friend. Who's the goddess of luck again? I owe her a flower.

313.speaker: Karlach
313.text: Now that we're old pals, how would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?

253.speaker: Player
253.text: I'm not interested in making friends.

377.speaker: Karlach
377.text: Oh boy, an arsehole! Winning you over will be entertaining.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Maybe it'll help if we start with a little fun. How'd you like to help me kill some evil bastards?

321.speaker: Karlach
321.text: You know, I don't really want to kill you. So hear me out before you do something you can't take back.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You're a devil then. A soldier in the Blood War.
38.context: NodeContext: She indicates herself by way of introduction, almost like she'd forgotten to mention her name earlier, then gestures to you as an invitation to introduce yourself.

153.speaker: Karlach
153.text: Not by choice. I'm a good skull-crusher, but I never wanted to serve Zariel.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: You are a devil then. A soldier in the Blood War.
56.context: NodeContext: She indicates herself by way of introduction, almost like she'd forgotten to mention her name earlier, then gestures to you as an invitation to introduce yourself.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: The paladins of Tyr were right. You are a devil.
213.context: NodeContext: She indicates herself by way of introduction, almost like she'd forgotten to mention her name earlier, then gestures to you as an invitation to introduce yourself.

224.speaker: Player
224.text: What were you saying before we were interrupted?
224.context: NodeContext: She indicates herself by way of introduction, almost like she'd forgotten to mention her name earlier, then gestures to you as an invitation to introduce yourself.

374.speaker: Karlach
374.text: Right. Some so-called paladins of Tyr are in hot pursuit of yours truly. Karlach.
374.context: NodeContext: She indicates herself by way of introduction, almost like she'd forgotten to mention her name earlier, then gestures to you as an invitation to introduce yourself.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'm here to take your head.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Seems like you have a lot of enemies.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire dies down. Calms to default state.

202.speaker: Karlach
202.text: Nothing but. But... maybe you don't need to be one of 'em. You're no bounty hunter. I saw you before. On the mind flayers' ship.
202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire dies down. Calms to default state.

263.speaker: Player
263.text: What quarrel do you have with these paladins?

389.speaker: Karlach
389.text: Believe me, these guys are anything but holy knights. They serve an archdevil; the same one I -

201.speaker: Player
201.text: I serve the Just God. What quarrel have you with His faithful?

132.speaker: Karlach
132.text: None at all. In fact, it may upset you to hear some of Zariel's goons are posing as followers of your fella.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: I'm in the process of teaching them a lesson about -

260.speaker: Player
260.text: I'm here to kill you, not make small talk.

181.speaker: Narrator
181.text: *One horn. This is the devil Wyll has been tasked to kill.*

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *One horn. This is the devil you've been tasked to kill.*

252.speaker: Karlach
252.text: Hope you're not planning on taking another swing at me, mate. Might not go your way this time.
252.context: NodeContext: Last time you saw the player they attacked you.

305.speaker: Karlach
305.text: There you are. Thought I'd have to track you down myself, murderer.
